attributes.action: Demand the sacking of the Education Secretary Gavin Williamson
attributes.additional_details: The vast majority of students sitting their A-level results around the country have been effected by the education secretaries woeful and inconsistent planning that has been changed last minute several times leading to confusion among students and teachers and many people missing out on their first choice universities crushing their dreams.
attributes.background: I would want the current government to sack the current education secretary due to his woeful planning ahead of A-level results.

rejection.details:
We can't publish petitions about honours or appointments. That includes calling for Ministers to be sacked or to resign.

If you're concerned about a particular policy or decision that's the responsibility of Government or the House of Commons, you could sign or start a petition about that.

Since you started your petition the Government has announced that GCSE and A-level students will receive their centre assessment grades: https://www.gov.uk/government/news/gcse-and-a-level-students-to-receive-centre-assessment-grades

Prior to this announcement being made, we had published the following petitions: 

Reverse all exam grades back to teacher’s own predictions: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/334491

Review the decision to use previous data to calculate exam grades: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/306773

Allow free and accessible appeals of GCSE and A Level calculated grades: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/334013
